title: UK weather forecast: Lightning and plunging temperatures ahead of windy weekend
text:

Brits can expect gale-force winds this weekend as the wet and chilly weather continues, with temperatures once again plunging below 10C today.

Today lightning will hit south and south-east England, along with west and south Wales, as rain sweeps across the country.

The Met Office predicts wind gusts of up to 38mph on Friday, kicking off a blustery weekend.

This evening there will be sunny spells and showers in England, Wales and Northern Ireland, mostly in the west.

(Image: PA)

Scotland will be cloudy with rain in the north and west but mostly dry with isolated showers in the south and east. Showers will persist in the west for much of the night.

Tomorrow will be a dry and bright start for much of England and eastern Scotland.

However Northern Ireland, Wales and western Scotland will be mostly cloudy with showers.

Through the day cloud will push eastwards, which will increase the risk of showers across eastern areas.

There will also be brisk south-westerly winds.

Friday will be mostly grey and cloudy but thundery showers are likely after noon in western Scotland.

(Image: PA)

Saturday looks set to be mostly cloudy with outbreaks of rain across England and Wales, with bright but rainy conditions in Scotland and Northern Ireland.

Speaking about today's weather, a spokesman for netweather.tv predicted: "With low pressure close to the northwest, another day of sunshine and showers.

"(A) band of showers moving through many areas on a brisk or strong westerly wind and perhaps longer spells of rain in the west."

The spokesman said it will feel a little cooler than yesterday due to the wind, with temperatures reaching 15C.

They added: "Thursday perhaps seeing fewer showers across southern and eastern England, with many places staying dry with sunny spells.

"Further north and west showers merging into longer spells of rain spreading in from the west.

"Friday could see a band of rain shift southeast across England and Wales, reaching south-east England by the evening, Scotland and Northern Ireland seeing sunny spells and blustery showers."

Met Office five-day weather forecast

Today:

A mixture of sunny spells and showers. Showers heaviest and most frequent in the west with a risk of thunder, whilst some eastern areas remain dry. Windy.

Tonight:

Further showers are likely near western coasts but many inland and eastern areas becoming dry with clear spells. Remaining windy.

Thursday:

A dry, bright start in the south and east. Clouding over, with showers in the northwest, then persistent rain moving eastwards. Windy, with coastal gales in the west later.

Outlook for Friday to Sunday:

Remaining unsettled with showers or longer spells of rain, and often windy with a risk of gales at times particularly on Friday and Sunday.
